Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with a some painful mistakes”
Reviews.Author: Brian_Schoppe
Reviews.Content: We stayed here prior to boarding the Disney Cruise ship. We had to groups that were flying at differnt times in our party and had asked for adjoining rooms. When we arrived we were told that the adjoining rooms were not available and they would have to split us up. This was a real let down as we were travelng with infants. Also, when I checked in, I told them I wished to put both rooms on my credit card which I though meant that both rooms had been checked-in. However, with the second part of our party arriving around midnight we were surpised when we received a call around 9pm telling us that they had given our room away and that they would have to move that part of the party to another hotel but comp that room for the night. Since our ride was picking us up at this hotel the next morning it put a real kink in our travel plans, but it was eventually overcome. My only other complaint was that we had specifically requested a pack-in play be in the room when we arrived and had to wait a long time fime after we checked in for to arrive. Not fun with a cranky tired infant. Other than those things the hotel was fine. Besides their mess-ups the front desk staff went out of their way to be accomidating. They even provided us some free milk for our infant from the kitchen. You could definately tell they were overwhelmed by some competition going on at the airport convention center. The free airport shuttle was nice, but it services a few other hotels in the area so you may have to wait to be dropped off. The room itself was quite large. Like most springhills it is a Studio suite vs. a one bedroom like an embassy. The room was very clean and they provided a lot of extra linens. The beds were very comfy and you didn't hear much noise from the near by aiport or approaching aircraft. Like one of the previous posters said, the free internet was very slow. The large LCD tv had a good selection of programming but was lacking much programming for kids (it is Orlando afterall). Breakfast was nice. They had a nice assortment of warm and cold items. it isn't the embassy suites made to order breakfast, but enough to fill you up. Was glad they had milk here for our babies as the small shop did not carry it. The pool was nice, but small. Enjoyed swimming here with my son. It looks like they have done some recent concrete work to its apron. There was a nice selection of restruants within walking distances: Tony Romas, Chili's and a BBQ place too.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Surprise”
Reviews.Author: jyoung3381
Reviews.Content: We are Marriott Platinum Elites and usually stay at Marriotts and Courtyards. But the Springhill line has become a great alternative, especially for the annual free night from the Marriott Credit Card. The Springhill Orlando Airport was a great choice. It is obviously a new Hotel with great functional rooms...microwave, small refrigerator etc. Everything was where it was suppossed to be. Clean and fresh smelling too. The breakfast was the largest surprise. Usually at Springhills there is one person setting up and refilling the breakfast. The breakfast setup at this Hotel was the best ever at a Springhill. Congratulations to the breakfast manager. Everything was where it was suppossed to be. They even had two coffee setups...one at each end of the room to accomodate all. Now the negatives... the internet service during the busy evening hours was TERRIBLE. In the early morning hours it was OK. The other negatve was check-in. It went smoothly, but the young man from Panama was more interested in talking with his friend at the front desk than providing superior customer service to us. But this is common at the SpringHill brand. Adequate customer service...butnot Superior Customer Service.

Reviews.Title: “We liked that hotel”
Reviews.Author: AllKnowMother
Reviews.Content: A huge clean and comfortable room. Very good mattress. Very good service at breakfast. An excellent, hepfull and friendly service at front desk by a young worker ( I think his name was Hedar ). It was the first time ever, that a hotel manager asked us upon checking out if we have a reservation for our next accomodation and he offered us helping with that. Well done.

Reviews.Title: “It's a great stop over”
Reviews.Author: mrmusic4ads
Reviews.Content: It's a great stopover hotel, clean and spacious. I've stayed for both work and pleasure and the staff is very good. Breakfast is your typical springhill suites and always fresh. I like the patio outside and the pool has always been clean and warm. The only missing item in the pool area is a hot tub. Rooms are clean, bed comfortable. The bathroom & shower area well designed using available space. Internet and wifi is the only issue being slow. Location is easy access to food and other central Florida destinations.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Comfortable Beds, Good Breakfast...SLOW INTERNET!!!”
Reviews.Author: NicknLibnna
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel and it's only 4 years old. The beds are super comfortable and the breakfast is good and hot everyday! However what stands out the most is the CUSTOMER SERVICE!!! Marian, Yurani & Martha at the font desk are FANTASTIC. They will go out of their way to make you feel comfortable and make your stay as pleasant as possible. My one complaint, which is something that has been said time and time again is that the internet is HORRIBLY SLOW!!! Please know that they are aware of this and are working on improving it but don't bug the great people at the front desk, there is nothing they can do about it!

Reviews.Title: “Great alternative to staying at the airport Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: KinderTeacher20
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I recently attended workshops at the Hyatt located in the Orlando Airport. At first I was disappointed that I was not able to book a room at the Hyatt because they were fully booked. That quickly changed when we were greeted by the very helpful and friendly staff at the front desk, enjoyed the comfortable accommodations, and loved the complimentary breakfast (especially the yogurt, blueberry and granola parfait). We also used the hotel's free airport shuttle which saved us from having to pay parking fees at the Hyatt. We were always picked up within 10 minutes of requesting the shuttle service except once when we had to wait about 20 minutes (still not bad!). It took less than 10 minutes to get to the airport, very convenient. I asked a local about the many hotels in the area and which he would recommend and he said that this one is one of the newer ones and he would recommend it. I am so grateful to the TripAdvisor reviews which is what I used to find this hotel. I will definitely come here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for close proximity to airport.”
Reviews.Author: Linemon
Reviews.Content: Free airport shuttle, but you have to call the hotel from the ground floor pick up area (head towards the lower parking spot numbers, as the pick up is from this area) from a phone (make note of the hotel's main phone number), since they don't have a permanent hotel phone link in the terminal. Welcoming front desk upon check-in after a five minute drive, stopping to drop off at neighboring hotels. Clean, large room with separate couch, desk area and kitchenette away from bed area. Large screen tv, but no channel directory to narrow down your long channel surfing. Wi-fi in room, but poor speed. There was a ethernet plug on the desk, but doesn't work with a Ipad. Wi-fi was faster in the common area of the lobby and out front, but there are also two desktop computers in the lobby, free for usage, but they were slow too. Nice arrangement of the sink being separated from the toilet/shower area allowing multiple people to get ready at once. King size bed was comfy and lighting was excellent. Outdoor pool and fitness room present, but not experienced. Numerous chain restaurants (Chili's, Longhorn steakhouse, Tony Roma's) within walking distance, but expect a wait at some (except Denny's on this Friday night). Breakfast buffett was decent with a choice of hot and cold items, juices and coffee. Sign up for return shuttle to the airport at the front desk, because it can get crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Rooms, Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Arvid O
Reviews.Content: The rooms are large, new and well furnished. The free breakfast presented a lot of choices including eggs ans sausage, hot and cold cereals, waffles plus a large selection of pastries and excellent coffee. The lobby is spacious and has free internet access. The staff was helpful and had a warm welcome. We had an excellent dinner at the Bonefish Grill on the otherside of highway 436. Also in the area are TGIF Fridays, New York Diner (not open yet), Longhorn Steakhouse, Tony Romas and Chiles. My only complaint was that I thought the shower floor was slippery but my wife did not think so. We only paid $89 on a senior rate.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of good things, except hard to contact from airport for shuttle”
Reviews.Author: Promart1
Reviews.Content: When got in was hard to contact from airport for the shuttle (not listed at the airport boards of phone lists) so had to find number and dial using cell phone. So that was a bit stressful. Once got there though very good. Good service, close to airport (5 min), very clearn, lots of food places nearby (can walk), breakfast included (was okay -continental), wifi was good addition. Price was good.

Reviews.Title: “Pleased”
Reviews.Author: Paula P
Reviews.Content: This turned out to be a great place to stay for three nights. It is conveniently located, and although is very close to the airport, there isn't much noise. The rooms were a little small, but adequate for two people. We especially liked the configuration of the suite with the separate desk/living room area. Staff was very friendly and helpful. My husband enjoyed the lounge/business area in the lobby too. Breakfast was just ok, but there are restaurants all around if you're looking for more of a gourmet experience. It was cozy---particularly for an "airport" hotel. I would definitely stay here again, especially with the convenient access to the 528 Expressway.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel choice close to MCO airport”
Reviews.Author: pattiwilkinson
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night on 3/06/12 with a group of 5. Arrived about 9:30pm, got our luggage, and Marriott shuttle service picked us up quickly and brought us to the hotel. Check in was a breeze. It was late and we were hungry after our flight. There are several good restaurants (open late) within 1 block of the hotel. It seems like a safe area, we didn't feel at all uncomfortable walking around at night. We had two adjoining queen/queen rooms. You can call the hotel directly the day before and if they can accomodate your request for adjoining rooms, they will. Rooms were spotless and the beds/pillows comfortable. They even honored my request for extra feather pillows. Free WiFi faster than most (at least in my room). Complimentary breakfast was beyond expectations. ALL staff were friendly and helpful. Only stayed the one night but will absolutely make this my airport hotel in Orlando from now on. Can't beat the price and the value - AAA rate around $125/room including taxes. Well done, Marriott. This one shines.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: bkiesster
Reviews.Content: I hate to copy, but I am almost in complete agreement with the previous post. We stayed here for a night before our flight out of MCO. It is located very close to the airport and very convenient for a rental car return at the airport. There is an airport shuttle, but we didn't use it either. The rooms were comfortable and the breakfast was good for this price range. The staff was friendly and this place is a good value for the money. The suites are nice with a bedroom, a sitting area with wet bar, and a bath area. The bathroom and shower were nice and clean! I would stay here again if in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stopover Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vordenbaeumen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a night before a cruise after coming in late. It is very convenient located to the airport and has an Airport Shuttle, which we didn't use. The rooms were comfortable and the breakfast was very good, with a great selection. The staff was very friendly, overall a great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find”
Reviews.Author: Penelope352
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night. It is close to the airport. The breakfast was very good with a lot of selections. The rooms were clean and comfortable and very quiet. Staff was professional and helpful. Would stay here again. .

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Joywrk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a night after a cruise and a vacation with friends. It is extremely convenient to the airport, has a great breakfast and extremely comfortable rooms and is close to restaurants. There was a complimentary shuttle to the airport. We had had a bad experience before the cruise in Ft Lauderdale, a hotel that cost significantly more and was not at all nice. This review is likely showing the comparison. Staff was helpful and professional. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: mary h
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night prior to departing on Disney Cruise. Airport shuttle came within 15 min of my call. Hotel is rather drab from outside, but inside is warm and modern. Front desk staff were very helpful and welcoming. Room was large, clean and well appointed with 1 king bed, and a pullout full size sofa. Lovely tiled shower and spacious bath. WiFi in rooms. The breakfast buffet included in the price is excellent and the staff are very accommodating. Fresh fruit and juices plus scrambled eggs and waffles were plentiful. Dining area is large and pleasant. Overall, we would definitely stay here again should we go to Orlando again. Nice feature is that the next morning the hotel shuttle took us back to the airport to where we needed to catch the Disney Shuttle bus to Port Canaveral. Made for a nice stress-free start to our cruise .

Reviews.Title: “Top hotel right by the airport - Free parking, breakfast & great rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotter1188
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for one night since I had to be close by the Orlando airport. Definitely a great decision, if you need to spend the night in that area. The whole hotel is remodeled and looks great. A 24 hour complimentary airport shuttle is provided, along with free parking and free breakfast. The front desk staff was friendly and I had a quick check-in. The room was clean and actually larger than I had expected. The standard room has a big bathroom, a kitchenette and a separate living area (not an extra room, but a separated area), I was very happy staying here because the rooms are in great condition and better than expected. If you like a nice room with a view, ask for a room facing the pool area / lake when checking-in. I had a really nice sunset lake view that made my stay! Breakfast buffet was very good also. My stay was without any issues and I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good for overnight stay before oCruise”
Reviews.Author: mlwlpt
Reviews.Content: The first problem we had was getting the shuttle. We called 3 times before finding out that the shuttle was a contract service and the van would not say Springhill Suites. I had asked this on the second call. The lobby is open, airy and inviting. The morning breakfast was more than adequate. The rooms are small but have a microwave and mini fridge. The king size bed meant only one night stand and about 6" from that wall so you had to climb into the bed, which was high. The towels and face clothes were clean but were not plush. It was great to have free internet. We used Cocoa Beach Shuttle to take us to Port Canaveral. Within walking distance to restaurants and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel overall, convenient location near airport”
Reviews.Author: RedPawPrints
Reviews.Content: My husband was staying at this hotel for business, and our son and I tagged along for a vacation. The hotel and room was clean overall and in good condition. We had a king size and our son slept on the pull-out sofa bed. It was nice that there is a wall between the living room and bedroom sections, although it is not closed off completely. We stayed for about a week and the breakfast never varies, so after a while, it gets tiresome as the food is just standard fare. The hotel was full while we were there, but there was always room in the dining room. I noticed that quite a few people just grabbed food and brought it upstairs to eat in their rooms. If the weather was warmer, it would have been nice to eat outside as they had some tables set up, but it was too cold in the mornings. For a business traveler, the location near the airport is very convenient but be aware that Route 536 is full of tolls in all both directions and heading to the Kennedy Space Center, we could see that they were in the process of adding yet another toll plaza! The hotel's wireless internet in the rooms is pretty slow. It takes a very long time to load pages, and if you use the hotel's computer, its browser is so ancient that it prevented us from ordering online tickets. Because of their computer's limitations, printing docs is a real pain. Their network needs a major upgrade. Having a laundry room is very handy for business travelers who have to stay longer than expected. You can just walk down the hall instead of hauling everything to a laundromat. Most of the time we used the stairs instead of the elevator and the stair case is carpeted in brightly striped colors and well lit. The remote control for our TV had some kind of problem with the power button and it always took several tries to get it finally turned on. The hair dryer also did not work at all. Everything else was fine, or we did not use it, so we're not sure if they were okay. Daily room service was good. Overall, a very good hotel. Room was quiet even though it is near the airport. Jets never roared by while we were sleeping. Lot of mostly chain restaurants nearby. My husband spent so much time on business here, that he said he's tried them all and they are all pretty decent.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT AIRPORT BASE for WDW!!!”
Reviews.Author: SamiGalaxy
Reviews.Content: Another great stay @ SPRINGHILL SUITES as a base for WALT DISNEY WORLD .. .. And, although @ MCO, it's almost a direct shot to WDW & SEA WORLD thanks to the tollway (just $1.75) in each direction .. .. Nice morning buffet with the typical offerings but I always love the eggs and salsa .. .. POOL is comfortable but no jacuzzi .. .. There is a hidden gem north of the hotel > PROCCOLINO's PIZZA (4080 South Goldenrod) .. .. Great Margherita Pizza!!! And, there is a DENNYS, HOOTERS, etc. nearby .. .. Don't be afriad to make this your base for WALT DISNEY WORLD is you get a great rate like I did .. .. Thoroughly enjoyed staying here and will be back .. .. Don't be

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel near the airport”
Reviews.Author: viajer0mx
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a hotel near the airport and chose this one for its good ranking. The location is very good, close to the airport and with many restaurants within walking distance. Check-in was fast and staff was friendly. This was my first time in a SpringHill Suites property. We had a two queens suite. It was ok, although I expected it to be larger. The microwave and fridge were very convenient. The breakfast includes mostly cold items plus plain scrambled eggs and sausages. I took the free shuttle to the airport, it was 20 minutes late even though I registered at the front desk to reserve. A tip about the gas stations nearby, as mentioned in a previous review, they are indeed very expensive. Go up north on Semoran a few blocks and you will find a regular priced gas station.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, close to the airport!”
Reviews.Author: gregbooras
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here two weeks ago. I picked the hotel because it was close to the airport and they provide transportation both ways. I was very happy with the accommodations. The hotel is clean, the staff is friendly and rooms are very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: daniel_travel2011
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my son for 3 nights and we really enjoyed it. The staff are woderfull, the rooms are big, clean and well maintained. The breakfast area is spacious and there was a good variety of food. Ample parking space. It's just 7 minutes from the airport so it's great if you are coming from a tiring flight. It's a short drive from Universal Studios and about 40 minutes easy drive from Kennedy Space center. A very good place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay at a great price”
Reviews.Author: Longwood Traveler
Reviews.Content: Decided to stay here because I had very early morning flight out of Orlando. The check-in was quick and they took my reservation for the free shuttle to the airport the next morning. The room was spacious and the king bed was very comfortable. The sofa was a little hard but it was nice to have a small frig and free wifi. The bathroom set up is a little broken up with the sink in one area and the toilet and shower in a closed room. No bathtub but shower was spacious and the hot water was hot not tepid. The only real downside was the condom wrapper sitting atop the Bible that I discovered when I opened the drawer to the nightstand. Apparently they don't clean the inside of the drawers when the room is vacated. There is a reason I travel with Lysol and this is one of them. Breakfast is offered as part of the room rate but I had to leave too early to try it out. The shuttle arrived on time and got me to the airport in plenty of time. Overall, a very good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: BMIFlyer
Reviews.Content: I was only at this hotel for about 12 hours, so I can't give a full review. We stayed at this hotel the last night of our Disney vacation to save a little money over the Disney lodging and be closer to the airport for a morning flight. This location was perfect. The large studio suite was perfect for our family of four. Breakfast was excellent. The little exposure I had to the staff was very pleasant. The hotel seems a little older, but it is kept up well. The only issue we had was with the room temperature. If we dropped the thermostat slightly, the room would get very cold. If we raised it a couple of degrees, it would get too warm. My wife and I had a hard time getting the temperature right for sleeping. There are several restaurants in the area. A tip - if you are returning a rental car, the gas stations nearby are VERY expensive and do not advertise their prices from the street (there are ongoing legal battles on this as they are trying to gouge tourist). Go up the road north about a mile, and you will find reasonably priced gas stations.

Reviews.Title: “Big, Bigger, Biggest room!”
Reviews.Author: jvduren
Reviews.Content: I booked this Hotel with my frequent flying miles, I booked a room with 2 queen beds. So this was already a good start, but it even got better. Because at the time of check in there wasn't a room with 2 beds available, so we got 2 king (enormous spacious) rooms at no extra charge! Good service, nice staff and a good breakfast, all together made this a great stay even for one night. Located close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel BIG room close to everything”
Reviews.Author: djkBuf
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a shuttle to pick you up from the Airport which is only 5min away. Big spacious lobby with a nice lounge area with a flat screen tv and FREE computers and Internet to use. Free breakfast every morning with waffles, toast, cereal and fruit. They could easily charge for it but dont very nice! Rooms are huge with living room areas, kitchens with microwave, mini fridge and more. Five people could easily stay in the room and not feel cramped. Only bad thing is placement of rooms only tv it swivels to accommodate the bedroom area and the living room area. They should add another tv. Beds and pillows are very comfortable. Even though your close to the airport you never hear the planes. Lots of food options right in walking distance. If you wanna visit any of the theme parks they are very close. I went to Universal City walk and it was less than 10 miles away. Id stay in this area over International Dr. Any day. I WILL stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “One good night, and one not so much.”
Reviews.Author: mjw716
Reviews.Content: To be up front about this review I contacted the hotel manager upon arriving home and the money spent on the "bad night" that I will refer to has been credited back to me. I hold no ill feelings towards SpringHill Suites or Mariott Hotels. This will just be for informational purposes for others. We spent two nights here on our honeymoon. The first and the last night in particular. We did this to try and maximize our time on Disney property. The first night we called the hotel from the airport to get a shuttle. I don't think you actually HAVE to call them. They tell you one will be there in around 15 minutes. If you do call though you will be guaranteed a spot. Don't quote me on this, just seems that way. Everything with check-in went fine, the room was nicely cooled when we got in there. Shortly after we went to Tony Roma's for dinner. In my opinion it wasn't as good as I was expecting. We shared a meal though and got a free appy because we were staying at SpringHill. If it weren't for that we probably would have gone somewhere else. Back at the hotel the room was a nice size and the bed was comfortable enough, but after being on a plane for 7+ hours and a 1.5 hour layover with another 45 minutes waiting on the taxiway we could have slept on a few bales of hay to be honest. The next morning we stuck around long enough to have some of the free breakfast. I must say the selection was nice, from muffins and fruit to cereal, to hot items like sausages and bacon. They even had waffle irons to make your own waffles. If you want hot chocolate just ask one of the staff and they can get it for you. We got a ride shortly after back to the airport to catch the shuttle to Disney. The last night of our trip we stayed again. It cost a little bit more this time, but not a big deal. Oh I should mention, they never checked my ID for the AAA/CAA discount. Just thought I would mention that. Upon check-in the guy working the front desk asked us if we would be ok with an accesible room because there were no regular king rooms left. We were fine with that. I was actually curious to see the difference. All I can say is that the room seems a lot bigger. The walking areas are much wider for obvious reasons. The bathroom has a walk-in shower with a bench in the back. Other than that, nothing to complain about with it being accesible. One complaint we had though was the complete lack of a garbage can. I'm sure this was just an oversight and I pointed it out to the manager. After cheking in we had booked a time for the shuttle back to the airport for 5:30 am as we had a flight back to Vancouver at 8:30am. After we got to the room my wife decided to call the front desk and set a wake-up call for 4:30 am. The night was a little rough as the AC wasn't on when we got there so we turned that on for a little bit, but it was too loud to leave on all night. Suffice to say we both got a little warm and sleep became more restless. Well I got woken up by my frantic wife at 6 am going...WHAT TIME IS IT?!?! Clearly the wake-up call we had requested never came. We jumped out of bed and got dressed, missed out on the breakfast we had bought ahead of time as we wouldn't have time for the hotel's. As we were getting ready the room's phone rings and the girl at the front desk wants to know if we want on the 6 am shuttle as we had missed our 5:30 am shuttle. I was just like you notice THAT, but not our wake-up call??? Anyways, she apologized and when we finally got downstairs I reiterated my anger about not getting a wake-up call. The girl was like "Do you have any questions about your bill?" All I could say was "Yeah, why do I have to pay it when you can't even wake me up on time?" The end of the story is a happy one though, we made it on our flight although we smelt and felt gross and the stress was not a great way to start the day nor end our trip. All in all if I ever had to stay near MCO again I think I would stay here again. Only the next time I'll be sure to set my own alarm. Hope this helps future travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: flyerNewYork
Reviews.Content: Spring hill suites is a great place to stay when in Orlando. It's 1 mile from the airport and it has a lot of places to eat with in walking distance. You get a free breakfast paper and internet. You will think the help is your family because they try to help you in every way possible. This is a great hotel and the location is a short drive to Disney, Universal, and of course Sea World. The beaches are 1 hour away along with the space center.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Springhill Suites Orlando Airport”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTraveler319
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Springhill Suites Orlando Airport after a delayed flight out of NJ right before Hurricane Irene. We didn't arrive in Orlando until almost 1 AM. After receiving our luggage, we called for the 24 hour airport shuttle. It came within 10 minutes. During check-in, we asked the gentleman at the front desk if we could receive a late check-out considering the time we were arriving and our complete exhaustion. He gladly accommodated us. We booked a suite w/a king bed and a sofabed. It was like a one bedroom suite - without the door dividing the rooms. It was very clean and comfortable. The breakfast was very good and even with the very busy crowd of families, the staff kept the dining area well stacked and spotless. We really enjoyed our brief stay at this hotel. We would definitely pick this hotel again if we needed to be close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great for early morning flights!”
Reviews.Author: facs50
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay and I would recommend it for anyone leaving on an early flight. The hotel is 1-2 miles from the airport, and you only make one turn off Hazeltine National Drive to go straight to the airport. There are several restaurants nearby; the front desk has a good map with points of interest marked on it. I checked in about 5 p.m., got the map from the front desk, and found everything I needed within 1-2 miles of the hotel. I had dinner, fueled the rental car, and was back in the hotel by 6:30 p.m. One printer wasn't working to print boarding passes, but a second one worked well. CAUTION: The closest service station has gasoline prices well OVER $5/gallon, so avoid it. Ask the front desk where to find the best prices. When I was there, they suggested a 7-11 about a mile away. However, they weren't sure if it would be open at 4:30 a.m., so they suggested I fill up just before I came back to the hotel for the night. Great advice! The breakfast bar isn't open early, so I ate breakfast at the airport. Overall, it was a very good experience for my early flight. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Park and Fly is a great deal at this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: traveler007FL
Reviews.Content: We live 2 hrs from the Orlando airport and often have very early morning flights. We have stayed at this hotel a number of times and left our car there using the park and fly packages they offer. I had to write this time to share how remarkably helpful AND consistent the service has been! We had the customary friendly check in, clean and comfortable room, good and healthy breakfast, and exceptional service to and from the airport! And, we saved money leaving our car there with the added benefit of not being exhausted before we ever boarded our early morning flight! The staff is great and they do an exceptional job of making sure they are meeting the Marriott standard of customer service and quality! Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient location, nice hotel, good value”
Reviews.Author: JimBobTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights when we came to see the final shuttle launch, STS 135. The hotel was clean, well trained staff, pretty nice room. Only complaints were: the surface area in the bath room was very very small, almost no room for shaving etc. and the "reading lights" were recessed cannisters that were at a bad angle for reading and actually impeded it. But a good overall value, nice breakfast, nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very new, very pleasant, good staff”
Reviews.Author: grouphotelrates
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a great lobby. The small water feature at the entrance was great along with the updated furniture and the business "library" area was another plus. The rooms were very spacious and comfortable. Our two double bedded room had a pull out couch too along with extra sheets and pillows. THe fridge and microwave are always a plus at any hotel and this one has those too. By far, the best feature of this hotel is their breakfast and staff. Both were incredible. The breakfast was eggs, waffles, bagles, yogurt and fresh fruit along with cereals pastries and donuts. I could not have asked for more.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience - Clean Rooms”
Reviews.Author: LLTG
Reviews.Content: My famiy stayed here for 1 night in June - we were picking my husband up from the airport and we could not have been any closer! Rooms were super clean, staf was very nice and my daughter and I arrived at noon which was 4 hours prior to check in and they accoodated us. Her and I were able to go to the pool and relax before his flight got in. Would definately stay again. This would be a good hotel if you are visiting Universal/ Sea World area (about 10 minutes) but far enough away from the hussle and bustle of that area. Disney is too far from this property unless you like driving 20-30 minutes depending on traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Good value but a bit far from Disney.”
Reviews.Author: pvbmom
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel due to the fact that the reviews gave praise to it's breakfast, cleanliness, and service. The rooms were very clean, breakfast was okay. It was not as nice as you would get at a Residence Inn. The beds were very comfortable. We also booked it due to it's convenience to Disney and it is not. It took over a half an hour and we had to pay several tolls. We would pay more and stay closer next time.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for an airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: GoBSUBroncos
Reviews.Content: The room itself was nice, roomy and stocked like you would expect from a Springhill Suites. Our problem was the number of kids running up and down the hall at all hours of the night and very little noise deadening. We had to catch a 4:30 am shuttle, so needed a decent nights sleep which didn't happen...

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Near Orlando Airport”
Reviews.Author: 5280TravelLover
Reviews.Content: This newly built (2007) airport hotel has all the amenities you need, and is very clean. The standard suites are perfect with separate bathroom sinks from the shower and toilet, and they have a good-sized seating/living area for the price. Nice kitchen and all very clean and comfortable. It also has a nice pool area with some chaise lounge chairs and a decent sized fitness center. The buffet breakfast was good enough, and the service all around (restaurant, house-keeping and reception) was excellent and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: AustinBizTraveler
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, not as trendy or nice as the one I stayed in Flagstaff, AZ last November. This was only my second time in a SpringHill Suite, but I like the setup of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “A+++++”
Reviews.Author: aboutmememe
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel. We stayed here one night before going on a cruise. The staff gets an A+. Everyone was really nice and went out of their way to make us comfortable. We did have a run in with one of the shuttle drivers but I will not lower the hotel’s score because of one person especially since the other drivers were great. It is in a good location and we were able to walk to certain places. The hotel lobby was clean and quiet. The rooms are huge and clean. We had a great time the short time we were at the hotel. Oh I forgot to mention that the breakfast buffet was the best!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay if you need to be by the airport”
Reviews.Author: Anoini2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here overnight. The room was clean and it had a microwave and fridge with a mini sink. It doesn't have the 'new' Springhill decor but it was clean and it didn't look outdated at all. The room had two queens (or it could have been a double) and a sofa bed. It's great that they have a divider between the two beds and the sofa bed. They had free wifi and the hot breakfast was great. I really like their oatmeal. They also gave us two free bottle of water. You can also get extra ones at the fitness room. I wouldn't mind stayiing here again if I need to be close to the airport. I couldn't remember if I hear the planes, I must have been very tired.

Reviews.Title: “Be aware of this hotel”
Reviews.Author: GSIBrat
Reviews.Content: The hotel may be wonderful... when you get in the room. However, beware, traveller! You may very well never see it. I had a non-refundable reservation, made on their own website over a month in advance. Got to hotel, reservation clerk says, "sorry, we overbooked." They did put me in another hotel, but I did not find it encouraging that this could happen in the first place. I asked the woman, "how could this happen?" She said, the reservation system keeps accepting bookings although they are full. So, despite the good reviews, you might want to reconsider committing to a booking at this hotel. I, for one, really hate coming to a place with full expectation that I have paid for a place, and finding that they didn't really mean it! OH, and according to tripadvisor, their hotel is 3 star, and the place they put me in is 2.5 star (Hawthorn, Wyndham, which is very close). Not having seen the hotel rooms here I can't compare the quality, but if your star rating system means anything, they put me in a lower standard place, and did not offer me any financial compensation for a price difference. Of course, this is extremely difficult to pin them down on, as the prices change day by day! So I guess they can get away with anything they want, attributing it all to their faulty reservation system? You be the judge... From my point of view, it looks a bit dicey. PS Hawthorn was very nice but it seems to be closer to the highway than I had wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay!!”
Reviews.Author: SummerItalia
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 rooms at this hotel as a short stop before going to Miami on cruise. Arrived at the hotel on December 31st/2010 we was welcome to the hotel by a very friendly and professional staff. Everything was beautiful and clean – hotel lobby, rooms and location was great with a beautiful landscape and the lake, and restaurants in short walking distance. That evening we walked to Chili's and celebrate there our New Years Eve. It was great!! we got great service, delicious food and hats!! Complimentary shuttle from the airport to the hotel was greatly appreciated, as well as the free wireless internet, coffee maker with complimentary coffee/tea in the room. The next morning we awake to a very nice buffet breakfast with many choices, fresh fruits in a nice and pleasant breakfast area. Parking was also free at this hotel – we rented a car next morning. We love the hotel, the location and the surrounding area and will stay there again!! Thank you everyone at the SpringHill Suites Orlando Airport!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay by airport”
Reviews.Author: buckeye627
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Springhill Suites In Feb. before a cruise. Had to get to Orlando a day early due to the snow storms across the country so had 2 nights at Springhill. Hotel was very nice, rooms were great, free breakfast was very good, and they have free transportation to and from airport. Staff was very helpful and did everything they could to make our stay a good one. A lot of nice places to eat close by and about 15 minutes to Florida Mall. Highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the best”
Reviews.Author: janet48603
Reviews.Content: Being a frequent visitor to Orlando, we have stayed at about different 10 Orlando airport hotels. This is the best. The room was spacious and immaculate. The breakfast buffet was generous and tasty (eggs, sausage, waffles, etc). The staff was amazing. We arrived at the airport around midnight, and when we called for a shuttle we were told the next one was already fully booked and we would need to wait for next one. We were frustrated, but then delighted when the second shuttle came only about 5-10 minutes after the first. At the front desk, we were greeted by a very friendly Katie. Checkout involved dropping keys at the desk on our way to the shuttle. Where the stay really became exceptional when I called the hotel the next day when I couldn't find my ultrasonic toothbrush I thought I had left behind. The front desk person Madeline made several calls to housekeeping to try to track down the missing toothbrush. The next day the hotel general manager repeated and intensified the efforts to sort through the lost and found items. To my embarrassment, I found the toothbrush myself packed in an obscure pocket of my carry-on. I felt the staff did a great job of handling a challenging guest situation, with continual pleasantness and courtesy. I only wish I hadn't created "the problem". So....to answer your question, would I stay here again? Yes, in two weeks when I am next needing an airport hotel. Absolutely!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Julilem
Reviews.Content: We highly recommend this hotel if you need to stay at the airport. It's within walking distance to restaurants. The breakfast is good, well set up, with plenty of seating. It looks like it's new and the price was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch staff & accommodations”
Reviews.Author: 1hyplady
Reviews.Content: In November we will have our 3rd meeting @ this Springhill Suites. Everything from working w/Natasha in Group Sales to the Front Desk, Housekeeping, the breakfast room staff, the housemen are all so pleasant which makes hosting a meeting at this hotel one of our favorites. The hotel is well appointed with very good meeting facilities. More importantly though is the staff. One returns to a hotel because of how they are treated. You can get hotels by the airport for less but you can't buy a good experience. It is earned. Breakfast included in room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: Deb_traveller
Reviews.Content: If you want to be near the airport, I recommend this hotel! Nice location within a few miles of MCO. We stayed here overnight for an early flight out in the morning. The hotel is new and in great condition. The suites are nice with a small seating area and nice comfortable bedroom. I really liked the lights directly over the headboard; they were controlled by a switch close by--great for reading! Small sink but nice shelves around it. We had a view of a small lake and the outdoor pool from our window. Breakfast was good with a few hot items along with the usual fare. I hope to stay here again when we fly in and out of Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Very fine accommodation conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: No.1 Arrow
Reviews.Content: I overnighted here, arriving very late at night because of a delayed flight. Despite the late hour the complimentary airport shuttle arrived promptly, which was a harbinger of the excellent service I subsequently received. My room was spotless and spacious. The large flat screen tv swivelled so that it was easily visible from both the bed and sitting areas. The only puzzling thing was the surprisingly small number of channels available. Although I was situated next to the elevators, my room was exceptionally quiet. In the morning I discovered that I had a very pleasant view of a large pond shared by 2 or 3 adjacent hotels. Breakfast was available in a cheerfully sunny room. The staff there was very friendly and helpful even though I arrived just a few minutes before the 10 AM closing time, and the complimentary breakfast offerings were among the most generously varied I have found in any hotel, including scrambled eggs and turkey sausages. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Out Stay”
Reviews.Author: TravellerGal
Reviews.Content: My husband I stayed at the Springhill Suites for pre and post cruise. The hotel is very close to MCO. We rented a car from Budget and the hotel offered free parking. Room was clean and comfortable. Breakfast in the morning was good. The hotel has a business centre with 2 computers and free Internet access. In the mornings, the sound of planes overhead can be heard but we were up early so it didn't disturb us. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GetawayGangAlberta
Reviews.Content: The free hotel shuttle was quick to pick us up even though it was 1am. The gentleman at the front desk was friendly and efficient. The suite was large with good beds. It was clean but there was a little dust around the edges. The breakfast was well prepared and ample. It was an easy walk to the Hertz at the Airport Marriott (the desk clerk offered to get the shuttle for us but we chose to walk). The only faults were that the window mount airconditioner was a little noisy and you did hear some airplane noise in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay near airport”
Reviews.Author: Lis80
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights for a business trip and had a comfortable stay. The rooms are nicely arranged for a living/working area with a sofa, couch, desk, microwave, and refrigerator. And the other part of the room is the bed and bathroom. There isn't a lot of counter space, but still very nice. Complimentary breakfast is served and the spread is the typical continental breakfast - bread, muffins, waffles, eggs, sausage, yogurt, etc... It's very close to the airport and the Hertz rental car returns. You can walk to nearby restaurants too.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel near the airport”
Reviews.Author: kkl2856
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night on Christmas eve. Our flight arrived at, then midnight, waited 20 min for the shuttle to get us to the hotel. Since it was late, there were no places nearby that's open. We ate cup noodles that we bought, but the rooms has no plates or bowls,even though there is micrwave and frig. Free breakfast was nice since we have small kids. The hotel is within walking distance to Hertz Rental where we picked up the rental car. Overall, it did exactly why we picked this hotel: airport pickup, free breakfast, and walk to Hertz. For the price, this is better than the Marriott down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Near Airport”
Reviews.Author: traveller006_8
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here for one night after a Disney Trip over Thanksgiving weekend. It was conveiently located near the airport. We dropped off our rental car and called the hotel and the shuttle came to pick us up. It is within walking distance to a few restaurants and they gave us coupons for these as well. The hotel is very well-maintained and clean. Free breakfast in the morning was nice as was the complimentary shuttle service to the airport. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel near the airport”
Reviews.Author: JRE67
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight on our way out of Orlando. Nice hotel in a good location near the airport and most of the car rental places in the area*. Room was large and friendly. The beds were large and very comfortable. The morning breakfast was good. The hotel is not too far off the main road of the area, meaning it is easy to find someplace nearby to eat. We had little interaction with the staff, but those we did talk to were helpful. Check-in and out were painless. *Note that there is a gas station in the area (right across the street from the Hertz lot) that charges over $4.50/gallon (twice the going rate) for gas - trying to gouge people returning their cars. They obviously know what they're doing since they don't have their price posted like most normal gas stations do. There's a 7-11 a mile or so up the road, as well as a few other stations nearby, selling for reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel Rocks - we will be back!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Minimom56
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic - from the moment we checked in until we left, we were very impressed!!! The staff was knowledgeable and extremely helpful at all times! The hotel was sparkling clean and the furnishings were top-notch - in addition, it was the best night's sleep I've had in ages - it was SOOOOO quiet even if we were only a mile from the airport!!!! And, at the rate we paid, you can't complain!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place- too bad they didn't clean our room”
Reviews.Author: rsfred
Reviews.Content: nice, new hotel-stayed 2 nights- were gone til late afternoon and were surprised the room hadn't been cleaned before we returned about 5- maids worked in hall for several hours- we left to go eat, returned and still hadn't been cleaned- went down to the pool with grandchildren, returned and still hadn't been cleaned- called front desk about 9 p.m. and someone brought 4 bath towels- I asked about washcloths and they got some but didn't have any hand towels on the cart- finally about 10 p.m. went to front desk and asked for some clean drinking glasses and hand towels- someone finally brought me some and I took them to room myself-- next morning asked to speak to manager and they said one wasn't on site on Sundays- receptionist quickly offered $50 off my bill which was really nice of her. I've stayed in Marriott's for 30 years and never had this happen before. Evidently the maid was only cleaning rooms that were unoccupied because guests had checked out. Strange! And no manager on duty??

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: ProudMom2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Marriott (Springhill Suites) June 11-15, 2009. My daughter and son-in-law arrived first - before 11:30 and asked if an early check in was possible. They allowed them to go ahead and check in. We had reserved a Queen Suite. It was a little small for 5 people but doable. Our refrigerator didn't work and when we called about it, a maintenance guy was at our door within 5 minutes. He replaced the refrigerator and we had no additional problems with it. We had breakfast every morning - it was a very nice continental breakfast. The usual offerings of cereal, yogurt, toast/bagels plus homemade waffles (YUMMY) along with sausage patties, egg rounds. Also fresh fruit (apples and bananas) Housekeeping did a great job - leaving extra towels for us. We were on the 3rd floor - no noise problems at all. The pool was small but felt wonderful after a hot day at local attractions!! Plenty of towels outside at the pool. The hotel was VERY clean and everyone who worked there that we dealt with were WONDERFUL and very accommodating. Mini safe in one of the closets. Bag of bed linens in closet for the sofa bed. I would stay here again and again and again! Just a note - if you plan to bring your xbox/wii for the kids in the evening, you are not able to connect via the internet - they have that blocked. There is no restaurant at the hotel but every food choice imaginable is available within 10 miles. One thing I would recommend if you are going to be coming and going a lot - buy a sun pass for all the tolls they have!! If you get the express pass, the money never expires so even if you don't visit often, you still have it.

HotelInfo.Name: SpringHill Suites Orlando Airport
HotelInfo.Address: 5828 Hazeltine National Drive, Orlando, FL 32822
